title: Mandrake ward and stealth champions.
body:
I see mandrake ward as two long term outcomes.
-the death of stealth champions
-the birth of stealth champion changes.

With the introduction of the Mandrake ward, Stealth now has more counter play, as a majority of stealth champions have been balanced around having stealth in their kit - a lot of their survivability, duellist abilities and damage has been taken away over the years.

Does the  Mandrake ward,

Signal the start of a stealth champion overhaul? Balancing around the ward, gives Riot a chance to emphasize unique champion strengths rather then being held back by, 'Oh this champion walks into lane invisible."

Or

Will {{champion:28}} , {{champion:29}}  and {{champion:35}}  have their power severely chopped down and left to rot?

What do you think

replies.body:
Where is the "Neither this game should not do anything to stealth champs who rely on it to function" vote button?

Also, I'm very happy that Teemo wasn't in that list :)

I have got to say I think that having stealth based champions in the game *without having stealth* is really a terrible idea.
I mean evelynn's stealth practically died when you could see her without a ward, and what's the point of playing her now?

I mean really, stealth champions are exactly that. *stealth* champions.
and if they can't turn invisible they just can't be *stealth* champions because league of legends, sadly, is not a first person shooter
